title: IAMA Psychologist pretending to be a new player. Results are scary :/
body:
So I'm a Diamond 5 player, Top 3 ranking for Malzahar on OCE and a qualified psychologist. I've long been interested in the interaction between players since I played back in Season One, particularly the de-individualisation that a large population of players seem to exhibit. 

I've been wanting to level up my smurf for a while and I figured end of season is a perfect time to do so. I had started recording my games and wanted to have a bit of fun, so I had an ongoing joke with my friends to pretend to be a newbie. Asking beginner questions and looking completely incapable, but then surprising my team when I played well. I was expecting a bit of fun, some positive vibes and some laughs. Instead I've so far had "Kill yourself", "This is completely CrepeVictim's fault" and "I'm afking because he's new". Part of me wants to create a highlight reel of the worst players I've met. Not to mention every game I've been reported for being new, and I am currently chat restricted. So there goes my roleplaying aspect.

Really, I shouldn't be surprised. One of my strongest memories of LoL was my very first game. I picked Rammus because "he looked cool and was fast". I had no idea what I was doing and trying to pick up elements of the game like last hitting, getting turrets and somehow trying to figure out what to buy (recommended built list didn't exist then). Of course, I sucked and got beaten badly. Someone was saying stuff to me which I didn't understand, my mate simply said "He's basically saying you're rubbish". So there it is, my first memory is being abused. Nice to see it hasn't changed in the 5 years I've played.
